snippet: State Senator Adriano Espaillat said Monday that Representative Charles B. Rangel’s margin of victory in the June 26 Democratic primary was insurmountable.
abstract: New York State Senator Adriano Espaillat says he will drop his legal challenge to the results of his narrow loss to Rep Charles B Rangel in the Democratic primary election for the 13th Congressional District; concedes that his results were 2 percent short of Rangel's; Espaillat, while not making a formal announcement, suggests that he will run to keep his State Senate seat in September .
lead_paragraph: State Senator Adriano Espaillat said Monday that Representative Charles B. Rangel’s margin of victory in the June 26 Democratic primary was insurmountable.

headline.seo: Adriano Espaillat Concedes Defeat by Charles Rangel, Will Drop Challenge
headline.main: Rangel’s Opponent Gives Up And Will Halt Court Challenge
headline.print_headline: Primary Challenger Says Rangel Has Won the Race
